name: Noah Varland
statement: My name is Noah Varland and I am a sophomore at Highlands High School. I have been doing theater for about 2 years now, and continue to take theater classes with Jason Burgess. I have done 7 full length productions, as well as 2 One acts, and have worked with Highlands and CAST multiple times. I consider myself dedicated, and willing to do anything asked of me. I will always come to a rehearsal or performance prepared and ready to give it my all. I have performed in a variety of ways, I have killed, rapped, roared, and even eaten on stage. I have also done duo improv in the past, so if something were to go wrong, I can usually find a way to stay focused, and just keep going. I have also been nominated for a Cappie award for my performance as Tobias Ragg in Sweeney Todd. Although I didnâ€™t win, I consider a nomination to be a very special, once in a lifetime opportunity.
other_notes: Acted in one act shows written and/or directed by students in Highlands High School's Directing & Playwriting courses (2022/2023 school year).

Participated in Northern Kentucky University 2023 Opiod-Impacted Family Support Program (OIFSP) Project. Acted (paid role) in a short film used to raise drug and alcohol awareness for NKU students (August 2023).

awards.text: Nominated for 2023 Cappie Award for Best Featured Actor for portrayal of Tobias Ragg in Highlands High School's production of Sweeney Todd. Sweeney Todd won 7 Cappie Awards, including Best Musical and Best Song.

press.text: …Tobias, played by Noah Varland, was innocent and sincere in his approach to the character during ‘Not While I'm Around,’ which made it all the more heartbreaking.

link.text: Loretta Rubin, Walnut Hills High School Critic Team
